document_data.name: Vellum
document_data.value1e: 8 [[gp]] per sheet ([[magic scroll]]){{Cite dragon/117/Dungeoneer's Shopping Guide|24}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Vellum''' was a high-quality writing surface material made from [[calfskin]].{{Cite dragon/69/Runestones|13}}
document_data.Description: Vellum was similar in form and function to other kinds of writing surfaces such as [[paper]], [[parchment]], and [[papyrus]], though rarer and more expensive. It was made of animal hide, like parchment, but was made exclusively from the scraped and tanned hide of calves, producing a superior material.
document_data.Availability:
[[Aurora's Emporium]] sold vellum sheets for 1 [[gp]] each, alongside various other writing surfaces and tools.

In [[Waterdeep]], the [[League of Skinners and Tanners]] handled all aspects of tanning and leatherworking, including the production of vellum.

[[Calaunt]] was a great producer and exporter of leatherwork including vellum.
document_data.Usage:
Valuable projects such as building plans, academic treatises, and [[wizard]]'s tomes were often created upon vellum.

Vellum was an ideal material for creating [[spell scroll]]s, producing more reliable results than [[papyrus]] and [[parchment]].

''[[Detect poison]]'' used a strip of blessed vellum, turning black in the presence of [[poison]].
